chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall a b d : Z, is_gcdZ a b d -> is_gcd Z IdZ multZ OZ a b d

Premises:
IdZ = fun _ : Z => True : Z -> Prop
Inductive Z : Set := OZ : Z | pos : nat -> Z | neg : nat -> Z Arguments pos _%nat_scope Arguments neg _%nat_scope
is_gcd : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> S -> S -> S -> Prop
multZ = fun x1 x2 : Z => match x1 with | OZ => OZ | pos n => multpos x2 n | neg n => multneg x2 n end : Z -> Z -> Z
Inductive is_gcdZ : Z -> Z -> Z -> Prop := gcd_OZ : forall b : Z, is_gcdZ OZ b (absZ b) | gcd_mod : forall b a d q r : Z, b <> OZ -> is_diveuclZ a b q r -> is_gcdZ r b d -> is_gcdZ b a d
gcd_mod : forall b a d q r : Z, b <> OZ -> is_diveuclZ a b q r -> is_gcdZ r b d -> is_gcdZ b a d
is_gcdZ_sind : forall P : Z -> Z -> Z -> SProp, (forall b : Z, P OZ b (absZ b)) -> (forall b a d q r : Z, b <> OZ -> is_diveuclZ a b q r -> is_gcdZ r b d -> P r b d -> P b a d) -> forall z z0 z1 : Z, is_gcdZ z z0 z1 -> P z z0 z1
is_gcdZ_ind : forall P : Z -> Z -> Z -> Prop, (forall b : Z, P OZ b (absZ b)) -> (forall b a d q r : Z, b <> OZ -> is_diveuclZ a b q r -> is_gcdZ r b d -> P r b d -> P b a d) -> forall z z0 z1 : Z, is_gcdZ z z0 z1 -> P z z0 z1
Znumtheory.Zis_gcd_sym : forall a b d : BinNums.Z, Znumtheory.Zis_gcd a b d -> Znumtheory.Zis_gcd b a d
gcd_unicity_apart_sign : forall a b d1 d2 : Z, is_gcd Z IdZ multZ OZ a b d1 -> is_gcd Z IdZ multZ OZ a b d2 -> d2 = d1 \/ d2 = oppZ d1
diveuclZ_rect : forall (a b : Z) (P : diveuclZ a b -> Type), (forall (q r : Z) (i : is_diveuclZ a b q r), P (divexZ a b q r i)) -> forall d : diveuclZ a b, P d
diveuclZ_sind : forall (a b : Z) (P : diveuclZ a b -> SProp), (forall (q r : Z) (i : is_diveuclZ a b q r), P (divexZ a b q r i)) -> forall d : diveuclZ a b, P d
diveuclZ_ind : forall (a b : Z) (P : diveuclZ a b -> Prop), (forall (q r : Z) (i : is_diveuclZ a b q r), P (divexZ a b q r i)) -> forall d : diveuclZ a b, P d
diveuclZ_rec : forall (a b : Z) (P : diveuclZ a b -> Set), (forall (q r : Z) (i : is_diveuclZ a b q r), P (divexZ a b q r i)) -> forall d : diveuclZ a b, P d
diveucl_rec : forall (a b : nat) (P : diveucl a b -> Set), (forall (q r : nat) (g : b > r) (e : a = q * b + r), P (divex a b q r g e)) -> forall d : diveucl a b, P d
gcdZ_i : forall a b x : Z, is_gcdZ a b x -> {x : Z | is_gcdZ a b x}
Znumtheory.Zis_gcd_for_euclid2 : forall b d q r : BinNums.Z, Znumtheory.Zis_gcd r b d -> Znumtheory.Zis_gcd b (BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.mul b q) r) d
gcd_OZ_absZ : forall b : Z, is_gcd Z IdZ multZ OZ OZ b (absZ b)
divZ : forall a b : Z, b <> OZ -> diveuclZ a b
have_gcdZ = fun a b : Z => {d : Z | is_gcdZ a b d} : Z -> Z -> Set
P = fun a : Z => forall b : Z, have_gcdZ a b : Z -> Set
divexZ : forall a b q r : Z, is_diveuclZ a b q r -> diveuclZ a b
gcd_null : forall (S : Set) (A : S -> Prop) (Mult : S -> S -> S) (O a b : S), is_gcd S A Mult O a b O -> a = O /\ b = O
gcdZ_exists : forall a b : Z, have_gcdZ a b
Zdiv.Z_div_mod_eq : forall a b : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.gt b BinNums.Z0 -> a = BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.mul b (BinInt.Z.div a b)) (BinInt.Z.modulo a b)
integrityZ = fun a b : Z => Z_rec (fun a0 : Z => multZ a0 b = OZ -> {a0 = OZ} + {b = OZ}) (fun _ : multZ OZ b = OZ => left eq_refl) (fun (n : nat) (H : multZ (pos n) b = OZ) => right (tech_integ_posZ n b H)) (fun (n : nat) (H : multZ (neg n) b = OZ) => right (tech_integ_negZ n b H)) a : integrity Z multZ OZ
is_diveuclZ = fun a b q r : Z => b <> OZ /\ leZ OZ r /\ ltZ r (absZ b) /\ a = addZ (multZ b q) r : Z -> Z -> Z -> Z -> Prop
Inductive diveuclZ (a b : Z) : Set := divexZ : forall q r : Z, is_diveuclZ a b q r -> diveuclZ a b
BinInt.Z.pow_add_r : forall a b c : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 b -> BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 c -> BinInt.Z.pow a (BinInt.Z.add b c) = BinInt.Z.mul (BinInt.Z.pow a b) (BinInt.Z.pow a c)
BinInt.Z.gcd_greatest : forall a b c : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.divide c a -> BinInt.Z.divide c b -> BinInt.Z.divide c (BinInt.Z.gcd a b)
BinPos.Pos.gcd_greatest : forall a b p : BinNums.positive, BinPos.Pos.divide p a -> BinPos.Pos.divide p b -> BinPos.Pos.divide p (BinPos.Pos.gcd a b)
gcd_OZ : forall b : Z, is_gcdZ OZ b (absZ b)
gcd_null2 : forall (S : Set) (A : S -> Prop) (Add Mult : S -> S -> S) (O : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_ring S A Add Mult O Opp -> forall d : S, is_gcd S A Mult O O O d -> d = O
gcd_unicity_apart_unities : forall (S : Set) (A : S -> Prop) (Add Mult : S -> S -> S) (O I : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_unitary_commutative_ring S A Add Mult O I Opp -> integrity S Mult O -> forall a b d1 d2 : S, is_gcd S A Mult O a b d1 -> is_gcd S A Mult O a b d2 -> exists x : S, inversible S Mult I x /\ A x /\ d2 = Mult d1 x
BinPosDef.Pos.gcd = fun a b : BinNums.positive => BinPosDef.Pos.gcdn (BinPosDef.Pos.size_nat a + BinPosDef.Pos.size_nat b) a b : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.gcd (_ _)%positive_scope

```coq
Lemma goal: forall a b d : Z, is_gcdZ a b d -> is_gcd Z IdZ multZ OZ a b d.
Proof.
  intros a b d H.
  generalize dependent d.
  induction H using is_gcdZ_ind.
  - intros.
    apply gcd_OZ_absZ.
  - intros.
    destruct H2 as [H2 H3].
    apply IHH2.
    rewrite <- Znumtheory.Zis_gcd_for_euclid2 with (q := q) (r := r) (d := d).
    apply Znumtheory.Zis_gcd_sym.
    apply H1.
Qed.```
